means: Bursting Day 爆炸日(2月18号，在冰岛的冰水中海冰爆裂和破碎)

sentence.Network_en: The camps are said to be bursting at the seams.
sentence.Network_cn: 据说帐篷的缝合处快炸线了。

sentence.Network_en: We'll go there bursting to give it our all.
sentence.Network_cn: 我们将去那里，渴望献出我们的一切。

sentence.Network_en: She was bursting to announce the news but was sworn to secrecy.
sentence.Network_cn: 她急不可待想宣布这个消息，但却发过誓要守口如瓶。

大学英语四级常用词组 ... burn oneself out (因过劳而)筋疲力尽 burst into 闯入；突然发作 burst up 爆炸；失败；突然发怒.

entry.def: If a place is bursting with people or things, it is full of them.

example.ex: The place appears to be bursting with women directors.
example.tran: 这里似乎到处都是女性主管。

example.ex: ...a terraced vegetable garden, bursting with produce.
example.tran: 种满了蔬菜的梯田形菜园

entry.def: If you say that someone is bursting with a feeling or quality, you mean that they have a great deal of it.

example.ex: ...a character bursting with energy and vivacity.
example.tran: 充满了活力和生气的角色

entry.def: If you are bursting to do something, you are very eager to do it.

example.ex: She was bursting to tell everyone...
We'll go there bursting to give it our all.
example.tran: 我们将去那里，渴望献出我们的一切。

entry.def: If someone says they are bursting, they are emphasizing that they need to urinate very soon.
If you say that a place is bursting at the seams or full to bursting, you are emphasizing that it is very full indeed.

example.ex: The camps are said to be bursting at the seams...
example.tran: 据说帐篷的缝合处快炸线了。

example.ex: The room was full to bursting.

sentences.sentence: "a spectacular display of detonating anti-tank mines"
